MAPPING.DESCRIPTION: This mapping is created as part of ITPR021782 - PFO-NDC Level Price Protection project. Using this mapping we are loading the RPS.TAPC_POST_APC_RPT table sourcing the required data from the claim and transaction level GDX tables useful for DIR reporting purpose.
MAPPING.NAME: m_Load_TAPC_POST_APC_RPT

TABLEATTRIBUTE.NAME: Sql Query

MAPPINGVARIABLE.DESCRIPTION: This value is used for cleanup purposes.
MAPPINGVARIABLE.NAME: $$CURR_RPSDM_PRD_MINUS_1

MAPPINGVARIABLE.DESCRIPTION: This value is used for cleanup purposes.
MAPPINGVARIABLE.NAME: $$CURR_RPSDM_PRD_MINUS_6

MAPPINGVARIABLE.DESCRIPTION: This value is used for cleanup purposes.
MAPPINGVARIABLE.NAME: $$CURR_RPSDM_PRD_MINUS_2

MAPPINGVARIABLE.DESCRIPTION: This value is used for cleanup purposes.
MAPPINGVARIABLE.NAME: $$CURR_RPSDM_PRD_MINUS_3

MAPPINGVARIABLE.DESCRIPTION: This value is used for cleanup purposes.
MAPPINGVARIABLE.NAME: $$CURR_RPSDM_PRD_MINUS_5

MAPPINGVARIABLE.DESCRIPTION: This value is used for cleanup purposes.
MAPPINGVARIABLE.NAME: $$CURR_RPSDM_PRD_MINUS_4

ATTRIBUTE.NAME: Maximum Memory Allowed For Auto Memory Attributes
Maximum Percentage of Total Memory Allowed For Auto Memory Attributes
Additional Concurrent Pipelines for Lookup Cache Creation
Save session log for these runs
Session Log File Max Time Period

WORKFLOW.DESCRIPTION: This workflow is created as part of ITPR021782 - PFO-NDC Level Price Protection project to load the RPS.TAPC_POST_APC_RPT
WORKFLOW.NAME: wf_m_Load_TAPC_POST_APC_RPT

SESSION.DESCRIPTION: This session will run only when RPS.TAPC_POST_APC_RPT table load fails. this will update the control table's status code to 99 (error).
SESSION.NAME: s_m_Dummy_Error_Status

ATTRIBUTE.NAME: Pre SQL
ATTRIBUTE.VALUE: UPDATE VRAP.TRPS_RPT_ADJ_PMT_CNTL SET PRCS_STAT_CD=99, LAST_UPDT_USER_ID='$PMWorkflowName', LAST_UPDT_TS=current timestamp WHERE PRCS_STAT_CD=20 WITH UR;

ATTRIBUTE.NAME: Fail task if any command fails
Fail task if any command fails
Fail task if any command fails
Write Backward Compatible Session Log File
Allow Pushdown for User Incompatible Connections

SESSION.DESCRIPTION: This session is created as part of ITPR021782 - PFO-NDC Level Price Protection project to load the RPS.TAPC_POST_APC_RPT.
SESSION.NAME: s_m_Load_TAPC_POST_APC_RPT

ATTRIBUTE.NAME: Post SQL
ATTRIBUTE.VALUE: UPDATE VRAP.TRPS_RPT_ADJ_PMT_CNTL SET PRCS_STAT_CD=90, LAST_UPDT_USER_ID='$PMSessionName', LAST_UPDT_TS=current timestamp WHERE PRCS_STAT_CD=20 WITH UR;

ATTRIBUTE.NAME: Email Subject
ATTRIBUTE.VALUE: NDC Price Protection data extract - Completed - %d

ATTRIBUTE.NAME: Email Text
ATTRIBUTE.VALUE: All claim information loaded in VRAP.TRPS_RPT_CLM_DTL, VRAP.TRPS_RPT_CLM_TRANS_DTL are rolled up at higher level (NDC) for Price Protection data and sent to RPSDM and stored in the table RPS.TAPC_POST_APC_RPT.

ATTRIBUTE.NAME: Email Text
ATTRIBUTE.VALUE:
This process runs to load the claims information in to RPS.TAPC_POST_APC_RPT by grouping on higher level.
The process changes PRCS_STAT_CD to 20 - TRANSMITTING right after it starts and changes it to 99 - ERROR if failed.
Please research on the cause of the failure. To rerun the workflow, 1. reset PRCS_STAT_CD in table VRAP.TRPS_RPT_ADJ_PMT_CNTL with status of 20 - TRANSMITTING.
Target Table: %t
%l
%r
Session Log is attached %g

ATTRIBUTE.NAME: Fail task if any command fails
Fail task if any command fails
Fail task if any command fails
Write Backward Compatible Session Log File
Allow Pushdown for User Incompatible Connections
